text:
The Province of Vicenza () is a province in the Veneto region of Italy. Its capital is the city of Vicenza.
Geography.
The province of Vicenza has an area of. The southern part is largely flat (the "Pianura Padana", here known as "Pianura veneta") except for a group of small hills (the "Berici Hills"), south of the city of Vicenza. There are many high mountains in the northern part of the province; the highest mountain of the province is Cima Dódici) that is high and is on the border with the province of Trento (Südtirol region).
The province of Vicenza borders to the north with the Trento province (Südtirol region), to the northeast with the Belluno province, to the east with the Treviso province, to the south with the Padua province, and to the west with the Verona province.
Population.
, there are 867,314 persons living in the province, for a population density of inhabitants/km².
